docs.lead_paragraph: Kansas became the first state to ban a common second trimester abortion procedure when Governor Sam Brownback, a Republican, on Tuesday signed into a law an act to halt what lawmakers said are "dismemberment abortions."

headline.main: Kansas Becomes First State to Ban a Second Trimester Abortion Procedure
headline.print_headline: Kansas Becomes First State to Ban a Second Trimester Abortion Procedure

docs.snippet: Kansas became the first state to ban a common second trimester abortion procedure when Governor Sam Brownback, a Republican, on Tuesday signed into a law an act to halt what lawmakers said are "dismemberment abortions."

docs.lead_paragraph: A New Jersey woman accused of dousing her newborn baby with accelerant, setting her on fire and leaving her in the middle of a road has been indicted on a murder charge.

headline.main: Mom Accused of Setting Baby Afire Indicted on Murder Charge
headline.print_headline: Mom Accused of Setting Baby Afire Indicted on Murder Charge

docs.snippet: A New Jersey woman accused of dousing her newborn baby with accelerant, setting her on fire and leaving her in the middle of a road has been indicted on a murder charge.

docs.lead_paragraph: Actress and U.N. women's rights ambassador Nicole Kidman is under fire for her role as the face of Etihad Airways, the second-largest airline of the United Arab Emirates.

headline.main: Nicole Kidman Under Fire for Ad Campaign for Airline Accused of 'Abhorrent' Policies
headline.print_headline: Nicole Kidman Under Fire for Ad Campaign for Airline Accused of 'Abhorrent' Policies

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers representing an American couple on trial in Indonesia argued Tuesday that there is no evidence of premeditated murder in her mother's death and sought light sentences if they are convicted.

headline.main: Lawyers Seek Leniency, See No Proof US Couple Planned Murder
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Seek Leniency, See No Proof US Couple Planned Murder

docs.snippet: Lawyers representing an American couple on trial in Indonesia argued Tuesday that there is no evidence of premeditated murder in her mother's death and sought light sentences if they are convicted.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant refugee women living in informal tent settlements are among the most vulnerable of the hundreds of thousands of Syrians who have found shelter in Jordan. They often can't afford doctor visits and face potential health hazards because of lack of running water and other challenges.

headline.main: AP PHOTOS: Pregnant Syrian Refugees Fearful of Future
headline.print_headline: AP PHOTOS: Pregnant Syrian Refugees Fearful of Future

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Chris Gibson, who says he will not seek re-election to his Hudson Valley district, is serving as something of a motivational speaker for his party and mulling a bid for governor in 2018.

headline.main: Chris Gibson, an Upstate Republican, Starts Early on a Possible Run for Governor
headline.print_headline: Newly Re-elected, an Upstate Republican Starts an Early Bid for Higher Office

docs.abstract: Republican Rep Chris Gibson, eyeing a 2018 bid for New York governor, announces that he will not seek re-election to his Hudson Valley district.
docs.snippet: Representative Chris Gibson, who says he will not seek re-election to his Hudson Valley district, is serving as something of a motivational speaker for his party and mulling a bid for governor in 2018.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas, like many other conservative states, has strived to make it difficult for women to have abortions. Recent state laws have forced dozens of clinics to close and left some regions without a place for women to go.

headline.main: Texas Lawmakers Want to Close 'Bypass' for Teen Abortions
headline.print_headline: Texas Lawmakers Want to Close 'Bypass' for Teen Abortions

docs.snippet: Texas, like many other conservative states, has strived to make it difficult for women to have abortions. Recent state laws have forced dozens of clinics to close and left some regions without a place for women to go.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss a Sunday Review essay about a dangerous combination.

headline.main: When She Is Pregnant and Obese
headline.print_headline: When She Is Pregnant and Obese

docs.lead_paragraph: An ambitious project to create a short film for each of Shakespeare’s sonnets is underway, with each movie shot at a different New York City location.

headline.main: Shakespeare’s Sonnets, All 154, Reimagined Through a New York Lens
headline.print_headline: Shakespeare’s Sonnets, All 154, Reimagined Through a New York Lens

docs.abstract: Sonnet Project, initiative that grew out of New York Shakespeare Exchange, aims to create short film for each of Shakespeare's 154 sonnets, with each film set in New York City; group, which began work in 2013, has completed its 100th film.
docs.snippet: An ambitious project to create a short film for each of Shakespeare’s sonnets is underway, with each movie shot at a different New York City location.

docs.lead_paragraph: Whether you call it a “childless” life or going “child-free,” it represents a demographic shift.
docs.abstract: Growing number of Americans choosing to remain childless represents nationwide demographic shift, with percentage of childless women ages 40 to 44 doubling between 1976 and 2006; reasons behind decision remain varied, but some decidedly modern rationales can be found in anthology Selfish, Shallow, and Self-Absorbed: Sixteen Writers on the Decision Not to Have Kids, edited by Meghan Daum.
docs.snippet: Whether you call it a “childless” life or going “child-free,” it represents a demographic shift.
